newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai central bank reaffirms independence.
newsitem.headline: Thai central bank reaffirms independence.

text.p: The Bank of Thailand on Thursday reaffirmed its independence from Thai politics in carrying out its job of maintaining monetary stability.
Central bank governor Rerngchai Marakanond said in a statement that he has followed a tradition observed by his predecessors in coordinating with the government on monetary policy.

"The central bank has consistently adhered to the principle of being independent in carrying out its responsibility but being independent does not entail any vocal conflict with the government...," he said.
Rerngchai's statement was a response to recent local press criticism that he has been submissive to politicians during his 10-month tenure.

The governor credited the central bank's success in defending the baht against several rounds of sporadic market attacks early this year to his style of mobilising central bank staff to work as a team.
